title: Understanding spontaneity
text:
To determine if the melting is spontaneous, we'll use the Gibbs free energy equation:

$$G=H-TS$$

where G is the Gibbs free energy, H is enthalpy, T is temperature, and S is entropy.

title: Relation between G and spontaneity
text: For the process to be spontaneous, G must be negative $$G<0$$. Use the equation $$G=H-TS$$ to determine the sign of G.

title: Convert units
text: Convert the entropy from $$\frac{J}{K} mol$$ to $$\frac{kJ}{K} mol$$ to match units with enthalpy.

title: Calculate TS
text: Calculate the product of the temperature T (279K) and the converted entropy S $$(0.0357$$ kJ/K*mol).

title: Calculate G
text: Use the equation $$G=H-TS$$ with $$H=9.87$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and $$TS=9.96$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ to find G.

title: Interpreting G
text: Since G is negative, interpret this in context of the process spontaneity.
